summary: In this context, methylsulfanylmethane (MT) is mentioned in relation to the O demethylation of methoxylated aromatic compounds by certain anaerobic bacteria. The study indicates that the demethylation process is dependent on sulfide, which suggests a biochemical interaction between MT and aromatic compounds. However, the specifics of this relationship are not deeply explored, focusing instead on the broader implications of volatile organic sulfur compounds (VOSC) production in freshwater sediments.
